item.title: Joyce add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Joyce add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Joyce add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Eighty percent of success is showing up." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Joyce add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Joyce add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use to be anything else." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Joyce add a quote by E. B. White
item.description: "I would feel more optimistic about a bright future for man if he spent less time proving that he can outwit Nature and more time tasting her sweetness and respecting her seniority." -- E. B. White

item.title: Joyce add a quote by Thomas Friedman
item.description: "Pessimists are usually right and optimists are usually wrong but all the great changes have been accomplished by optimists." -- Thomas Friedman

item.title: Joyce add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "...an optimistic mind-set finds dozens of possible solutions for every problem that the pessimist regards as incurable." -- Robert Anton Wilson
